name: Teddy Gu

projects.title: Walmart Sales Analysis
projects.description: Accurately forecast Walmart’s weekly sales using historical data, feature engineering, and gradient-boosted machine learning models. This end-to-end project includes data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, an API for live predictions, and a Jupyter-based analytics report.

projects.title: Instagram Clone
projects.description: This project is a clone of the Instagram android app made using React Native with Expo using firebase services (authentication, firestore and storage).

projects.title: Google Maps data collector
projects.description: A free and open-source Google Maps scraper with both command line and web UI options using GO programming language in order to scrape and compile data to export to CSV, JSON or PostgreSQL.

projects.title: Scraper
projects.description: Built a web scraper using Python to scrape for product ratings, reviews, and prices

projects.title: Voluntary(mobile app)
projects.description: Collaborated with a team of 4 to develop a React Native-based app that helps organizations get the word out for their volunteering events and incentivizes users to attend

aboutpara: I am a developer with a passion for building intelligent, data-driven solutions that merge AI, cybersecurity, and software engineering. I love working at the intersection of automation and analytics, creating tools that not only streamline processes but also enhance decision-making with meaningful insights. Most recently, I interned as a Software Engineer at Newegg, where I designed and deployed an AI-powered product review summarizer, integrating web scraping and MySQL to uncover data-driven strategies for boosting sales. Before that, I researched online privacy and cybersecurity at Macalester College, exploring how digital communities navigate security challenges. Whether it's optimizing data workflows, enhancing security, or building AI-driven applications, I’m always looking for ways to make technology more efficient and impactful.

resume.description: I am well-versed with React, Java, and Python.

experiences.bullets: Designed and deployed an AI based summarizer on the Newegg website for product reviews, Implemented a web scraper in Python to scrape product summaries and process them with an AI, Used MySQL to find data-driven insights on potential ways to increase sales/conversions

Researched usable privacy and cyber security on online platforms among Twitter and Tumblr among other sites with emphasis on fan spaces under the direction of Professor Abby Marsh, Conducted qualitative coding on meta essays, Identified and made suggestions to areas of cyber security in online spaces that could be improved
